thought_pattern: Ugh, my brain is a never-ending jumble of "what ifs" and "should haves"... I'm stuck reliving every single conversation with her, replaying the worst parts over and over like some twisted movie on repeat. Why did I say that? What if I had said something else?
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What's it like when you attempt to organize your thoughts about recent experiences?

thought_pattern: Ugh, what's going on is that I'm still stuck replaying yesterday's conversation with Sarah in my head and now I'm trying to remember every single detail, like the way she laughed at this one joke or how her eyes crinkled when she smiled... Why am I doing this? It's just a stupid conversation, but for some reason my brain won't let it go.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How much do you find yourself circling back to add more details or context?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on all these tiny details - like how the rain dripped down my shirt that one morning or what Sarah said to me during lunch - and I just can't seem to let them go, like my brain is trying to piece together some puzzle that doesn't even make sense... It's like trying to hold onto too many threads at once.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What occurs when you attempt to give someone the full picture of your situation?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on the tiny details of everything that's gone wrong lately - the way my boss talked down to me during that meeting, the sound of my roommate's snoring last night, and the stupid coffee shop mistake I made this morning. Why can't I just let it go? It's like my brain is a broken record player, stuck on repeat with all these fragmented thoughts swirling around me, making no sense whatsoever.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What happens when you attempt to create a coherent narrative of your struggles?

thought_pattern: Why do I always remember every little thing that happened? It's like my brain is a tape recorder playing back all these insignificant moments and I'm stuck reliving them. Ugh, the coffee shop scene still bothers me – why did I have to run into Sarah there?!
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How do you typically work through all the factors contributing to how you feel?

thought_pattern: Ugh, I'm stuck on replaying that fight with my sister again... every tiny detail is still vivid in my head - the way she raised her voice, the look on her face, the words we both said... and then there's all the other stuff too, like how I should've handled it differently or if I was just being too sensitive... But honestly, what even happened? Did anyone win? Was anyone hurt? Should I have done something else?...
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How do you typically work through the story of what's been happening to you?

thought_pattern:
What occurs when you try to make sense of complex situations in your life?

"I keep replaying every single conversation, wondering what I could've done differently, and why they responded that way; it's like trying to unravel a tangled mess of emotions and words... If only I had said this instead of that... Ugh, my brain won't stop spinning through all the what-ifs."
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What occurs when you try to make sense of complex situations in your life?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on that one conversation from last week where I felt so anxious, what was it exactly that they said? And wasn't there something else that happened before that, like a text message from an ex or... and then there were all those emails at work, did I even respond to them? Ugh, my brain is just a jumbled mess...
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What happens when you try to trace back through everything that's led to this point?

thought_pattern: I can't even remember what I was saying anymore because there's just so much to consider – like, did I lock the door this morning? Was it really 5 minutes late for that meeting or more? And why am I even stressing about this when I know I'm not perfect and nobody is... Ugh, my brain never stops racing with "what ifs" and it's suffocating me.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How much do you find yourself getting lost in the details when explaining things?

thought_pattern: I'm trying to explain what happened yesterday, but my brain is just flooding with every single detail – like the stupid traffic jam on the way there, and the weird conversation I had with that coworker who always talks too much... why do I need to remember all of this? It's not even relevant to the point I'm trying to make... But what if someone doesn't understand me without knowing these tiny little details? Maybe they'll think I'm being vague or dishonest, and then we'll get into an argument...
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How much background information do you feel you need to provide to be understood?

thought_pattern: I'm trying to make sense of this week's events, but my brain keeps jumping from one chaotic scene to another – like when John interrupted me at work again, and then I got stuck in that traffic jam on the way home, and did I even remember to pick up milk? Ugh, why can't I just focus on one thing?!
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What happens when you attempt to summarize your current circumstances?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on every little detail – the way the sun was setting behind the building, the awkward pause before she spoke up, and how my hands were shaking so badly I thought they'd fall off. But what's the point of even thinking about it? It's all just swirling together in this jumbled mess... I can't seem to pinpoint why it matters or what I'm trying to say, other than that something bad happened.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How do you typically tell someone about something important that happened?

thought_pattern: Ugh, okay, so remember when my mom got sick? And then there was that argument with my best friend? And oh, yeah, I totally forgot to pick up milk on the way home and I'm still thinking about it because what if they're out of stock now? But wait, wasn't it the following Monday that the email came in from HR about the company restructuring? And what's with all these receipts piling up on my counter? Why can't I just focus?!
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What's it like when you attempt to organize the timeline of significant events?

thought_pattern: Ugh, okay, so let's start from the beginning - I remember walking into that meeting feeling really anxious because Sarah was going to be there and I hadn't talked to her since our fight... Wait, what was it about again? Oh right, she was saying something about needing my input on this project... But why do I always get stuck thinking about the worst-case scenarios? What if she's still mad at me? Should I just avoid eye contact or...
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How do you usually process through the various aspects of difficult experiences?

thought_pattern: Ugh, okay, so I was supposed to meet Sarah at 2 PM, but then traffic got really bad and I got stuck on the highway for an hour, and when I finally arrived, she wasn't even there, just a text saying she had an emergency meeting... what does that mean? Did she forget or was it just another excuse? And did he cancel our plans again? And oh man, my stomach is still doing flips from the stress of it all.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What happens when you try to explain a situation you're struggling with?

thought_pattern:
Here is a possible internal monologue for someone experiencing Overwhelmed Narrative Processing:

"I'm replaying every conversation from the past week, reliving all the little details that never seemed important at the time. Like how Sarah's tone changed when she asked about my job search or why Tom didn't bother to text me back. It's like my brain is trying to make sense of it all, but there's no connection between these moments... yet I keep thinking about them as if they're all somehow connected, like a puzzle that won't come together."
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How do you usually process through all the different elements affecting you?

thought_pattern:
I keep replaying that argument with my friend in my head, but it's all jumbled up - was it because of what I said or did they really not listen? And then there's the thing with work, how come my manager is breathing down my neck for no reason... Ugh, why did I agree to take on that extra project again? 

(Note: The thoughts are disjointed, jumping between different topics and emotions, as per the description of Overwhelmed Narrative Processing.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What's it like when you try to connect different parts of your story together?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why did I have to go into that meeting today? Okay, so Bob said something snarky at 2:47 PM and then Sarah chimed in with her typical passive-aggressive tone, which made me feel like an idiot for even trying. And did I mention the air conditioning was broken again?! The sweat dripping down my back is still making me irritable... Wait, what were we talking about again?
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How much detail do you find yourself including when describing events?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why do they always ask me to explain? Can't they just get it? It's like trying to hold water in my hands - everything just spills out, one disjointed thought after another.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: What occurs when you try to help others understand the complexity of your experience?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on every little thing that went wrong during the meeting – I mean, who said those stupid things? And why did I wear that ridiculous tie? Ugh, my brain is a mess and I can't even recall what we were supposed to discuss first... Wait, was it about the Johnson account or the Smith proposal? Oh right, both. Now I'm thinking about how I spaced out during the presentation and missed the whole point of it all.
pattern_description: Excessive detailing of events with disjointed, unresolved thought fragments.
source_question: How much do you find yourself jumping between different aspects of events?
